column1: #Text=Polycrystalline NaFeAs samples with nominal composition NaxFeAs with 0.5 ≤ x ≤ 1 were synthesized by the solid-state reaction technique employed for Li111 [12], but with a small (5%) excess of Na.
#Text=The Na111 polycrystalline samples are black with metallic luster.
#Text=Post annealing around 300-400 °C, both inside the Ar-filled Nb tubes and under continuous vacuum, were also carried out for some synthesized samples.
#Text=Plate-like single crystals with dimensions of a few tenths of a millimeter were also obtained after prolonged heat treatment at low temperature.
#Text=All Na111 samples and the polycrystalline ones so obtained are extremely sensitive to air.
#Text=Careful steps in handling the samples were taken to minimize the sample exposure to air.

#Text=Both powder and single-crystal XRD analyses were performed, and the resistivity (ρ), the dc magnetization (M), the dc magnetic susceptibility (χ), the thermoelectric power and the specific heat (Cp) were measured, by employing the same techniques used for Li111, described above
